text:
Richard Benjamin Harrison Jr. (also known by the nicknames The Old Man and The Appraiser; March 4, 1941 – June 25, 2018) was an American businessman and reality television personality. He was born in Danville, Virginia, but raised in Lexington, North Carolina. He was best known as the co-owner of the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop, as featured on the History channel series "Pawn Stars".
Harrison was usually referred to by his nickname, "The Old Man".
Harrison died on June 25, 2018 in Las Vegas, Nevada from Parkinson's disease at the age of 77.
